question: how to identify orions belt
option1: . If you go outside and look south to southeast before dawn now, you'll notice Orion's Belt, which consists of a short, straight row of medium-bright stars. Just draw a line through Orion's Belt and extend that line toward the horizon. You'll easily spot Sirius, the sky's brightest star.
option2: If you go outside and look south to northeast before dawn now, you'll notice Orion's Belt, which consists of a short, straight row of medium-bright stars. Just draw a line through Orion's Belt and extend that line toward the horizon. You'll easily spot Sirius, the sky's brightest star.

question: how to use a compass
option1: To use a compass, hold the compass flat on your outspread hand in front of your chest. Next, turn the degree dial so that the orienting arrow lines up with the magnetic arrow inside the compass. Then, look at the travel arrow on the baseplate of the compass to tell you which direction you're facing.
option2: To use a compass, hold the compass at a diagonal angle on your outspread hand in front of your chest. Next, turn the degree dial so that the orienting arrow lines up with the magnetic arrow inside the compass. Then, look at the travel arrow on the baseplate of the compass to tell you which direction you're facing.

question: To smooth down the outside of a homemade ring.
option1: Wrap some masking tape around a large drill bit so that it is slightly larger than the inside of your ring. Twist your ring onto the bit, making sure it's held firmly in place. If it's still loose, add more tape then try again. Once the ring is on the bit, attach the bit to an electric drill and turn it on.        Wrap a small piece of wood in sandpaper, and hold the spinning ring against it to smooth the outside of the ring. Use increasingly higher grits to get it nice and smooth. Use a rough cloth once you're done sanding for a finishing touch.
option2: Wrap some masking tape around a large drill bit so that it is much larger than the inside of your ring. Twist your ring onto the bit, making sure it's held firmly in place. If it's still loose, add more tape then try again. Once the ring is on the bit, attach the bit to an electric drill and turn it on.        Wrap a small piece of wood in sandpaper, and hold the spinning ring against it to smooth the outside of the ring. Use increasingly higher grits to get it nice and smooth. Use a rough cloth once you're done sanding for a finishing touch.

question: How to make Delicious Dewberry Ice Cream at home.
option1: In a large bowl combine 4 cups half and half (Or light cream)1 1/2 cups sugar, and 1 tablespoon vanilla.  Stir until sugar dissolves.  Stir in 2 cups whipping cream. In a blender blend 4 cups fresh Dewberries Thorns until nearly smooth.  Add this to Ice cream mixture. Freeze in 4 or 5 quart Ice cream freezer according to manufacturers directions. Serve with fresh berries.
option2: In a large bowl combine 4 cups half and half (Or light cream)1 1/2 cups sugar, and 1 tablespoon vanilla.  Stir until sugar dissolves.  Stir in 2 cups whipping cream. In a blender blend 4 cups fresh Dewberries until nearly smooth.  Add this to Ice cream mixture. Freeze in 4 or 5 quart Ice cream freezer according to manufacturers directions. Serve with fresh berries.

question: How can I organize fasteners and parts when putting things together?
